name: Coconut Rice
history: Coconut Rice, known as 'Thengai Sadam' in Tamil, is a popular South Indian dish. It is often made on festive occasions and is known for its simple yet rich flavor, derived from the use of fresh grated coconut.
description: Coconut Rice is a delicious and fragrant dish made with rice, grated coconut, and tempered with spices and nuts. It's a perfect blend of nutty and savory flavors and can be enjoyed as a main dish or as part of a larger meal.

instructions.title: Temper the Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil or ghee in a frying pan. Add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, dry red chilies, asafoetida, curry leaves, and cashew nuts. Fry until the dals turn golden and the cashews are lightly browned.

instructions.title: Combine with Rice
instructions.description: In a large bowl, mix the cooked rice with the tempered spices, green chilies, and fresh grated coconut. Season with salt and mix well.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the coconut rice warm. It can be paired with curry, chutney, or served as a standalone dish.

tips: Use freshly grated coconut for the best flavor.
Be careful not to overcook the rice; it should be fluffy and separate.
variations: Add a spoonful of lemon juice for a tangy flavor.
Include green peas or grated carrots for added nutrition and color.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stove until warm.
presentationTips: Garnish with additional curry leaves or fried red chilies for a more appealing look.
Serve in a traditional banana leaf for an authentic South Indian experience.
